key_insight: LASER is a training-free conversion framework that enables high-quality feed‑forward 4D reconstruction models to run in streaming (causal) mode by aligning layer-wise feature scales, removing the quadratic memory bottleneck without retraining.
problem_solved: Offline feed-forward reconstructions (e.g., VGGT, π3) cannot handle streaming video due to quadratic memory growth and require costly retraining for causal variants; LASER lets practitioners deploy these strong offline models on streaming inputs efficiently while preserving geometric priors.
method: Layer-wise scale alignment: match and rescale intermediate multi-scale feature statistics so features remain stable across temporal chunks for causal processing.
Training-free conversion: wrap existing feed‑forward reconstruction networks with the alignment mechanism and lightweight buffering to produce streaming outputs without modifying model weights.
Memory-efficient streaming: replace quadratic global attention/memory with aligned, local causal propagation to achieve linear (or near-constant) memory while maintaining reconstruction fidelity.
impact: Practitioners can convert state-of-the-art offline 4D reconstruction models into real-time, streaming systems without retraining—reducing memory and compute costs while keeping high geometric accuracy, enabling deployment on resource‑constrained or latency‑sensitive applications.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: before (offline model, full-frame quadratic memory) vs after (LASER-converted streaming pipeline with layer-scale alignment and causal buffers).
Memory vs frames plot: quadratic memory curve for offline baseline vs linear/flat curve for LASER across increasing video length.
Feature-map alignment illustration: multi-scale feature maps from consecutive frames showing scale/residual alignment and stabilized activations.
Qualitative timeline: successive reconstructed frames/meshes showing consistent geometry and low latency compared to retrained streaming baselines.
paper_title: LASER: Layer-wise Scale Alignment for Training-Free Streaming 4D Reconstruction
paper_authors: Tianye Ding, Yiming Xie, Yiqing Liang, Moitreya Chatterjee, Pedro Miraldo
